title: 250 evacuated as Volcano of Fire erupts in Guatemala
description: About 250 residents have been evacuated from the slopes of Guatemala’s Volcano of Fire as red-hot rock and ash flowed down the slopes toward an area devastated by a deadly 2018 eruption

title: Mexican brand counterfeiting reaches new heights: Coca-Cola
description: Mexico has long had a problem with piracy and brand counterfeiting, but this week it reached a new height: fake Coca-Cola

title: Canada mulls expelling China diplomat for targeting lawmaker
description: Canada’s foreign minister said Thursday the country is considering the expulsion of Chinese diplomats over an intelligence agency report saying one of them plotted to intimidate the Hong Kong relatives of a Canadian lawmaker

title: How to watch King Charles III’s coronation: A guide to the key moments
description: It's Britain's first coronation in more than 70 years. Here’s how to watch the ceremony in which King Charles III will be crowned at London's Westminster Abbey.

title: Sons of 'El Chapo' deny US fentanyl indictment allegations
description: Sons of former Sinaloa cartel leader Joaqu�n “El Chapo” Guzmán have denied accusations made by United States prosecutors last month, saying in a letter that they have no involvement in the production and trafficking of the potent synthetic opioid fentanyl

title: Israel minister: Iran nuke enrichment could ignite region
description: Israel’s defense minister says Iran could have enough enriched uranium to make five nuclear weapons, and warned Tehran that proceeding to weapons-grade enrichment could “ignite the region.”

title: Belgium detains 7 on suspicion of planning terror attack
description: Authorities in Belgium have detained seven people, most of them Chechen origin, on suspicion of planning a terrorist attack

title: Kenyan court sets bail for pastor in parishioner death probe
description: A court in Kenya has ruled that one of two pastors under investigation for the deaths of more than 100 of their congregants can be released on bond or bail

title: Takeaways from AP report on Guyana's nascent oil boom
description: Guyana is poised to become the fourth-largest offshore oil producer in the world, placing it ahead of Qatar, the United States, Mexico and Norway

title: Fire consumes popular street market in Haiti
description: A large fire has torn through a street market in Haiti and consumed thousands of dollars’ worth of goods as vendors wailed over their losses

title: Kremlin accuses Washington of directing alleged drone attack on Putin
description: U.S. National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov "is just lying" in accusing Washington of directing the attack.

title: Norway climber aims to be fastest to scale 14 tallest peaks
description: A Norwegian who just became the fastest female to climb the world’s 14 highest mountains is now aiming to become the fastest person to complete the feat by beating the record set by a male climber in 2019

title: Killings reported in Benin's north
description: An attack by unidentified armed persons in the north of the small West African nation of Benin has killed ‘about 15 people,’ according to the government’s spokesperson

title: Beyond King Charles: Your guide to the world’s 28 other monarchs
description: The coronation of King Charles shows how the British monarchy often attracts the most attention. But there are wealthier, more powerful monarchies around the world.

title: Russia says Ukraine sent drones to kill Putin; Kyiv denies it. What we know.
description: The Kremlin said it is considering a "variety of measures" in response to the alleged assassination plot.

title: Israelis call out perks for ultra-Orthodox in latest protests
description: The anger against the status of the Haredi has long been a dynamic in Israeli politics, but it has grown more intense as the community has ballooned to roughly 13 percent of the population.

title: Investor buys Caribbean isles once owned by Jeffrey Epstein
description: A U.S. investor has bought two Caribbean islands that were once owned by disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein and where authorities allege many of his crimes took place

title: Shelling in Sudanese capital disrupts aid delivery efforts
description: Residents say heavy shelling in the Sudanese capital of Khartoum is disrupting efforts to deliver badly needed aid to trapped civilians as yet another fragile and frequently violated truce ran out

title: No coronation roles for Harry or Andrew. But their presence will be felt.
description: Among the many things King Charles III has inherited from his mother is the ultimate responsibility of dealing with his estranged son and disgraced brother.

title: As oil boom transforms Guyana, a scramble for spoils
description: Guyana is poised to become the fourth-largest offshore oil producer in the world, placing it ahead of Qatar, the United States, Mexico and Norway

title: Hungary's Orban bemoans liberal 'virus' at CPAC conference
description: Hungary’s populist prime minister has likened liberalism to a “virus” in an opening speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference in the Hungarian capital on Thursday

title: Italian philosopher Ordine wins prestigious Spanish award
description: Italian author and philosopher Nuccio Ordine has won Spain’s prestigious Princess of Asturias award for communication and humanities for 2023

title: Queen Elizabeth II’s coronation was televised and captivated the world
description: Queen Elizabeth's husband, Prince Philip, argued that televising the 1953 coronation would help modernize the monarchy. More than 32 million Americans tuned in.

title: 2 people killed in train accident in western Germany
description: Two people have been killed and several were injured in a train accident near the western German city of Cologne

title: 6 soldiers killed in shootout with militants in NW Pakistan
description: Six soldiers have been killed in a shootout with militants in a former stronghold of the Pakistani Taliban near the border with Afghanistan

title: Berlin school attack: Girl's life no longer in danger
description: Authorities say a young girl wounded in a knife attack at a Berlin school is no longer in a life-threatening condition

title: WHO fires scientist who led COVID search over sex misconduct
description: The World Health Organization says it has fired the scientist who led a high-profile delegation from the U.N. health agency to China two years ago to jointly look into the origins of the coronavirus pandemic, citing sexual misconduct

title: Iranian president meets Palestinian officials in Syria
description: A Palestinian official says Iran’s president has met with senior Palestinian officials in Damascus and expressed his country’s support to them

title: US joins UN in suspending food aid to Ethiopia's Tigray
description: The United States aid agency says it has suspended all food assistance to the northern Ethiopian region of Tigray “until further notice” while it investigates the theft of humanitarian supplies

title: No Pride for South Korea: Seoul denies parade permit, citing schedules
description: Seoul's city government said two events applied for permits on the same day — and the Christian youth event won. But Pride advocates see social conservatism at work.

title: Indian army helps defuse clashes in northeastern state
description: Indian army soldiers are patrolling the streets and enforcing a curfew after thousands of people clashed in a remote northeastern state, causing casualties and damage to homes and vehicles

title: Israelis block roads in protest against Netanyahu legal plan
description: Israelis have blocked roads and demonstrated against a contentious government plan to overhaul the judiciary

title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy expected to visit Int'l Criminal Court
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is in the Netherlands for a surprise visit to the city that is home to the International Criminal Court, which has issued an arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin

title: In photos: More than 130 dead as flooding, landslides hit Rwanda and Uganda
description: At least 129 people in Rwanda and six in neighboring Uganda are dead, authorities say, after weeks of torrential rain.

title: Spain's Juan Carlos I offers cautionary tale for Charles III
description: A playboy past that was once brushed under the carpet, a popular son whose telegenic family threatens to eclipse his own star, and endless leaks about his private life: Spain’s Juan Carlos I can empathize with the lot of Britain’s Charles III

title: Israeli military kills 3 wanted Palestinians in West Bank
description: The Israeli military says it has killed three Palestinians wanted in connection with a deadly attack against Israelis

title: DIARY: Waiting to leave Sudan, a hotel became a sanctuary
description: In better times, the Lisamin Safari Hotel in Khartoum catered to small tour groups that came to see Sudan’s little-known attractions — the ancient pyramids of Merowe and the coral reefs of the Red Sea

title: 8 people die in overnight fire in Czech city of Brno
description: Police says eight people have died in an overnight fire in the second largest city in the Czech Republic

title: Charles III will be crowned the U.K.’s king. Who else does he reign over?
description: Fewer nations recognize King Charles as head of state than when Queen Elizabeth II had her coronation ceremony, but the Commonwealth of Nations is growing.

title: Deadly bus crash with truck kills 14, injures 25 in Egypt
description: Egyptian media and local officials say a passenger bus has slammed into a slowly moving truck on a highway in southwestern Egypt, killing at least 14 people and injuring 25

title: Ukraine live briefing: Explosions heard in Kyiv after Kremlin claims attempt on Putin; Zelensky in Netherlands
description: Air raid sirens sounded across several regions in Ukraine. The U.S. Embassy in Kyiv issued a security advisory citing a heightened threat of missile strikes.

title: Lula's gun control push starts with counting Brazil's guns
description: President Jair Bolsonaro tried to convert a country with few weapons into one where firearm ownership and lack of regulation meant personal freedom
